summary: Acetic acid, also known as ethanoic acid, is a colorless, acidic liquid found mainly in vinegar. It has been used since ancient times. This compound is the second simplest carboxylic acid and is an important chemical in many industries. It's used to make things like photographic film, glue, and synthetic fabrics. In our homes, it helps remove limescale. In food, it regulates acidity and is used as a condiment (E260). In our bodies, a form of acetic acid is key in processing sugars and fats. Globally, about 17.88 million metric tonnes are made each year, mostly from methanol. However, making and using it can be dangerous to workers' health.
title: Acetic acid
